emails.subject: Your Weekly Reset Worksheet (PDF) + print version
emails.preheader: Download links inside for the standard and print-friendly PDFs.
emails.body_html:
Weekly Reset Worksheet

Here are your download links:

Download the standard PDF

Download the print-friendly PDF

A simple way to start

  1. Pick a consistent weekly time (10–30 minutes is common).
  2. Start with “This Week at a Glance” and list the deadlines you already know.
  3. Choose 2–4 time blocks for the week first, then expand as needed.

You can also bookmark the thank-you page for re-downloads: https://cc360-pages.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/the-key-coach-executive-functioning-reset/20260119/thank-you.html

emails.subject: How to do a Weekly Reset in 30 minutes (simple flow)
emails.preheader: A quick checklist that makes the worksheet easier to use.
emails.body_html:
Weekly Reset (30 minutes): a simple flow

If the worksheet feels like “one more thing,” here’s a lightweight way to use it without turning it into a big production.

A 3-part reset

  1. List: write down what’s due and what’s missing (don’t solve it yet).
  2. Choose: pick the smallest next actions for 1–2 days (not the whole week).
  3. Place: add 2–4 time blocks where those actions could realistically happen.

Re-download links if you need them:

  • Standard PDF
  • Print-friendly PDF

If you want the quick download page for bookmarking, it’s here: thank-you page.

Educational planning tool. Not medical or psychological advice.

Coaching and educational resources are not therapy and do not replace mental health care.

emails.subject: A calm Reset Script for homework check-ins
emails.preheader: Neutral phrases to keep conflict lower while staying on track.
emails.body_html:
Reset Script (neutral + brief)

Page 8 of the Weekly Reset Worksheet includes a short reset script. Here are a few options you can try as written or adapt to your style:

  • “Let’s look at what’s due and pick the next small step.”
  • “Do you want to start with the easiest one or the one due soonest?”
  • “What’s one thing we can do in the next 10 minutes?”
  • “If we were making this easier, what would we change for next week?”

If you want to pull up the worksheet again:

Download the standard PDF

Download the print-friendly PDF

You can also bookmark the landing page: https://cc360-pages.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/the-key-coach-executive-functioning-reset/20260119/index.html
